sub_topic: Determining the chromatic number of a graph.
message_1:
What is the chromatic number of the graph below?

```
      A --- B
       \   / \
        \ /   \
         C --- D
```

Hint: The chromatic number is the minimum number of colors needed to color the vertices of the graph such that no two adjacent vertices have the same color.
message_2:
The chromatic number of the given graph is 3.

One possible coloring is:
- Color A with color 1
- Color B with color 2 (since it is adjacent to A)
- Color C with color 3 (since it is adjacent to both A and B)
- Color D with color 1 (since it is adjacent to B and C, but not A)

No two adjacent vertices have the same color, and we used the minimum number of colors possible.
